title: McIlroy to front Golf Channel's digital push down under
text:
Professional golfer Rory McIlroy and NBC Sports are teeing up the launch of GolfPass, a subscription service combining tournament streaming, instructional videos, tee-time bookings and shopping, for Australian golf fans.

Mr McIlroy, who was voted the PGA Tour Player of the Year last month, teamed up with NBC Sports and the Golf Channel for the launch of the service in the US in February.

Rory McIlroy is behind the second coming of Golf Channel. AP

The Golf Channel was launched with the help of legend Arnold Palmer 25 years ago as the first sport-specific television network in the world. He passed away in 2016.

Mr McIlroy told The Australian Financial Review the link to Mr Palmer was a big factor in joining up with NBC Sports.

"The Arnold connection and the fact that in some ways it felt like I was being passed a torch," he said.
description: Professional golfer Rory McIlroy and NBC Sports are teeing up the launch of a subscription service combining tournament streaming, instructional videos, tee-time bookings and shopping for Australian fans.
